result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole S Robertson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today with the Clerk of Court's Office
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
*No contact with Roy Robertson, except with prior consent from her agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicole S Robertson in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF9, 16CF289 & 17CF19.

10:36 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Amended Information's have or will be filed on any felony cases to misdemeanor's.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF9:
Count 1 - No contest

16CF289:
Count 1 - No contest

17CF19:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 16CF9, Count 1 of 16CF289 and Counts 1 & 2 of 17CF19.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification; victim does not appear in Court today.
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CF9:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay a 90 day jail sentence 
5 days incarceration credit 
Placed on Probation for 24 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
No contact with Roy Robertson, except with prior consent of her agent
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today with the Clerk of Court's Office.

16CF289:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay a 30 day jail sentence - consecutive to16CF9
Placed on Probation for 24 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today with the Clerk of Court's Office.
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 16CF9

17CF19:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay a 30 day jail sentence - concurrent to Count 2 but consecutive to 16CF9 and 16CF289
3 days of incarceration credit
Placed on Probation for 24 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today with the Clerk of Court's Office.
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 16CF9

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay a 30 day jail sentence - concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to 16CF9 and 16CF289
Placed on Probation for 24 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today with the Clerk of Court's Office.
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 16CF9

Defendant Nicole S Robertson in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:30 p.m. Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA Louis Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Substantial Battery-Domestic Abuse.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $5,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes additional statements to the Court.  Requests a signature bond.
